results.title: Only two wheels
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Terry Jennings and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Emphasizing the importance of motor cycle riders seeing and being seen, this film highlights a variety of problems that normally confront the motor cyclist - lane changing, hazards on the road, car blind spots, careless pedestrians and emergency braking.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Saunders, Terry Jennings and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Olga de Amaral
results.creator_credit: S-M Productions and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: South American Olga de Amaral is one of the most outstanding weavers working today. She is particularly noted for the sheer size and scope of her work. An exhibition of her work came to Australia in 1975 and here the camera explores the rich, earthy colors, the texture and intricacy of each piece. Olga de Amaral worked with only two materials, horse hair and hessian, and the way she used these materials is a source of wonder and delight.

results.title: Moments in time
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Ron Lowe, Film Makers Australia and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Museums are revealed as “time machines”, freezing moments in time so that places and things we couldn’t normally see are made available to us, to look at and to study. Their role in the study of Australian ecology and their other services are also highlighted. Commentary by Steve Curtis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Saunders, Ron Lowe, Film Makers Australia and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Misconceptions
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Lesley Hammond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film looks at common misconceptions about contraception held by many teenagers. Through a dramatised situation, teenagers are shown that they need not fear being ignorant or misinformed, as sound information is readily and easily available from the Family Planning Association. Contraception is also shown as being the responsibility of both partners.

results.title: The Making of 'Sunday'
results.creator_credit: Edwin Scragg, Scope Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The process of making a feature film, in this case, the South Australian Film Corporation’s award-winning first feature film “Sunday Too Far Away”, is the subject of this film. The problems and joys of film-making are revealed through interviews with director Ken Hannan and star Jack Thompson. The staging of a car crash is among the aspects of film-making included in this film.

results.title: A Long walk home
results.creator_credit: Brian Bosisto, Jill Robb and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Flinders Ranges in South Australia are a remarkable chain of ranges and valleys penetrating the arid centre of Australia. The purity of its sunlight and colours is revealed in this study of the ranges and gorges and the flora and fauna of this ancient and fascinating region.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Bosisto, Jill Robb and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: A Little bit in all of us
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Bosisto Productions and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film encourages people to enjoy the solitude and splendour of our national parks, while taking precautions to avoid destruction and havoc. A typically Australian family, the Innes, are mildly satirised as they unwillingly get into a situation that took public money to rectify. Three major problem areas are covered: bushfires started by campers, people trapped on cliffs and people lost in the bush. The fact that it is costly and difficult to save people from these dangerous situations is highlighted.

results.title: The Inhabited man
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Peter Dimond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A talking flea makes a young man aware that he has scabies though he could have countless other organisms living on his body. Anxious, the young man visits a doctor who explains to him that whilst complete prevention is not yet possible, sound personal hygiene can cut down on the incidence of scabies.

results.title: Ian Chappell on cricket
results.creator_credit: Vincent O'Donnell, Terry Jennings and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Australian Captain, Ian Chappell, and three other Test cricket players, Ashley Mallett, Terry Jenner and Eric Freeman, demonstrate the elements of the game. Using freeze-frame and slow motion techniques, the subtlety of various batting strokes and bowling deliveries are revealed by the experts, from the way a wrist is turned to the intricate foot-work required.

results.title: Good news day
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film makes a statement about the attractiveness and cultural diversity of the Australian way of life by comparing scenes from Adelaide with the screaming headlines of newspapers and radio.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phillip Mark-Law and South Australian Film Corporation
